description:
## Overview
[github.com/hashicorp/vault/vault](https://www.vaultproject.io/) is a tool for securely accessing secrets.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Privilege Escalation. Under certain circumstances, an Entitys Group membership inadvertently includes Groups the Entity no longer has permissions to.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/hashicorp/vault/vault` to version 1.3.4 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Changelog](https://github.com/hashicorp/vault/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#134-march-19th-2020)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/hashicorp/vault/commit/18485ee9d4352ac8e8396c580b5941ccf8e5b31a)
- [Hashicorp blog](https://www.hashicorp.com/blog/category/vault/)
title: Privilege Escalation

description:
## Overview
[github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/util/session](https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd) is a Declarative continuous deployment for Kubernetes.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to User Enumeration. It is possible for attackers to determine the usernames of valid (non-SSO) accounts within Argo.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/util/session` to version 1.5.1 or higher.
## References
- [Argo CVEs](https://www.soluble.ai/blog/argo-cves-2020)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/commit/35a7350b7444bcaf53ee0bb11b9d8e3ae4b717a1)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/pull/3215)
title: User Enumeration

description:
## Overview
[github.com/concourse/concourse/skymarshal/skyserver](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/concourse/concourse/skymarshal/skyserver?tab=overview) is a module of Concourse CI/CD automation system.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Open Redirect. It allows redirects to untrusted websites in its login flow. A remote unauthenticated attacker could convince a user to click on a link using the OAuth redirect link with an untrusted website and gain access to that users access token in Concourse. (This issue is similar to, but distinct from, CVE-2018-15798.)
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/concourse/concourse/skymarshal/skyserver` to version 5.2.8, 5.5.10, 5.7.2, 5.8.1 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/concourse/concourse/commit/d058b7cca60a393abdea90fed38a0c6714256e4f)
- [Pivotal Security Advisory](https://pivotal.io/security/cve-2020-5409)
- [VMWare Vulnerability Report](https://tanzu.vmware.com/security/cve-2018-15798)
title: Open Redirect

description:
## Overview
[github.com/google/go-tpm/tpm](http://github.com/google/go-tpm) is a Go library that communicates directly with a TPM device on Linux or Windows machines.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Initialization. An improperly initialized `migrationAuth` value in Googles go-tpm TPM1.2 library versions prior to 0.3.0 can lead an eavesdropping attacker to discover the auth value for a key created with `CreateWrapKey`. An attacker listening in on the channel can collect both `encUsageAuth` and `encMigrationAuth`, and then can calculate `usageAuth ^ encMigrationAuth` as the `migrationAuth` can be guessed for all keys created with `CreateWrapKey`. TPM2.0 is not impacted by this. We recommend updating your library to 0.3.0 or later, or, if you cannot update, to call `CreateWrapKey` with a random 20-byte value for `migrationAuth`.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/google/go-tpm/tpm` to version 0.2.0, 0.3.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/google/go-tpm/security/advisories/GHSA-5x29-3hr9-6wpw)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/google/go-tpm/pull/195)
title: Improper Initialization

description:
## Overview
[github.com/couchbase/sync_gateway/db](https://github.com/couchbase/sync_gateway) is a horizontally scalable web server that securely manages the access control and synchronization of data between Couchbase Lite and Couchbase Server.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to N1QL injection. An attacker with access to the public REST API can insert additional N1QL statements through the parameters `startkey` and `endkey` of the `_all_docs` endpoint.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/couchbase/sync_gateway/db` to version 2.5 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/couchbase/sync_gateway/commit/97adb5b496aa96aa70398018ea96da913ffd8d8c)
- [Hisolutions Research](https://research.hisolutions.com/2019/06/n1ql-injection-in-couchbase-sync-gateway-cve-2019-9039/)
- [Release Notes](https://docs.couchbase.com/sync-gateway/2.5/release-notes.html)
title: N1QL injection

description:
## Overview
[k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/kuberuntime](https://godoc.org/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/kuberuntime) is a package that contains an implementation of kubecontainer.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insecure Permissions. Containers for pods that do not specify an explicit `runAsUser` will attempt to run as uid 0 (root) on container restart, or if the image was previously pulled to the node. This behaviour also occurs if `mustRunAsNonRoot: true` setting is used.
## Remediation
Upgrade `k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/kuberuntime` to version 1.14.3, 1.13.7 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/76665/commits/26e3c8674e66f0d10170d34f5445f0aed207387f)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/78308)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/76665)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1715726)
title: Insecure Permissions

description:
## Overview
[github.com/elastic/cloud-on-k8s](https://github.com/elastic/cloud-on-k8s) is a package that automates the deployment, provisioning, management, and orchestration of Elasticsearch, Kibana and APM Server on Kubernetes based on the operator pattern.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Cryptographic Issues. A weak random number generator is used for generating passwords. If an attacker is able to determine when the current Elastic Stack cluster was deployed they may be able to more easily brute force the Elasticsearch credentials generated by ECK.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/elastic/cloud-on-k8s` to version 1.1.0 or higher.
## References
- [Elastic Security Announcements](https://www.elastic.co/community/security/)
title: Cryptographic Issues

description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation. It allows the creation of CSV sheets that contain malicious content.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/gophish/gophish` to version 0.11.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gophish/gophish/commit/b25f5ac5e468f6730e377f43c7995e18f8fccc2b)
- [Security Advisory](https://herolab.usd.de/security-advisories/usd-2020-0052/)
title: Improper Input Validation

description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) when used in a deployment with NGINX reverse proxies in front of the Gorouters. An unauthenticated malicious attacker can send specially-crafted HTTP requests that may cause the Gorouters to be dropped from the NGINX backend pool.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/cloudfoundry/gorouter/proxy/handler` to version 0.204.0 or higher.
## References
- [CF Advisory](https://www.cloudfoundry.org/blog/cve-2020-5416)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/gorouter/commit/6af365bbbc3e6dbb5267b1ca47ec5460808a6837)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) via the Dashboard > Text Panel screen.
## Details

A cross-site scripting attack occurs when the attacker tricks a legitimate web-based application or site to accept a request as originating from a trusted source.

This is done by escaping the context of the web application; the web application then delivers that data to its users along with other trusted dynamic content, without validating it. The browser unknowingly executes malicious script on the client side (through client-side languages; usually JavaScript or HTML)  in order to perform actions that are otherwise typically blocked by the browser’s Same Origin Policy.

ֿInjecting malicious code is the most prevalent manner by which XSS is exploited; for this reason, escaping characters in order to prevent this manipulation is the top method for securing code against this vulnerability.

Escaping means that the application is coded to mark key characters, and particularly key characters included in user input, to prevent those characters from being interpreted in a dangerous context. For example, in HTML, `<` can be coded as  `&lt`; and `>` can be coded as `&gt`; in order to be interpreted and displayed as themselves in text, while within the code itself, they are used for HTML tags. If malicious content is injected into an application that escapes special characters and that malicious content uses `<` and `>` as HTML tags, those characters are nonetheless not interpreted as HTML tags by the browser if they’ve been correctly escaped in the application code and in this way the attempted attack is diverted.
 
The most prominent use of XSS is to steal cookies (source: OWASP HttpOnly) and hijack user sessions, but XSS exploits have been used to expose sensitive information, enable access to privileged services and functionality and deliver malware. 

### Types of attacks
There are a few methods by which XSS can be manipulated:

|Type|Origin|Description|
|--|--|--|
|**Stored**|Server|The malicious code is inserted in the application (usually as a link) by the attacker. The code is activated every time a user clicks the link.|
|**Reflected**|Server|The attacker delivers a malicious link externally from the vulnerable web site application to a user. When clicked, malicious code is sent to the vulnerable web site, which reflects the attack back to the user’s browser.| 
|**DOM-based**|Client|The attacker forces the user’s browser to render a malicious page. The data in the page itself delivers the cross-site scripting data.|
|**Mutated**| |The attacker injects code that appears safe, but is then rewritten and modified by the browser, while parsing the markup. An example is rebalancing unclosed quotation marks or even adding quotation marks to unquoted parameters.|

### Affected environments
The following environments are susceptible to an XSS attack:

* Web servers
* Application servers
* Web application environments

### How to prevent
This section describes the top best practices designed to specifically protect your code: 

* Sanitize data input in an HTTP request before reflecting it back, ensuring all data is validated, filtered or escaped before echoing anything back to the user, such as the values of query parameters during searches. 
* Convert special characters such as `?`, `&`, `/`, `<`, `>` and spaces to their respective HTML or URL encoded equivalents. 
* Give users the option to disable client-side scripts.
* Redirect invalid requests.
* Detect simultaneous logins, including those from two separate IP addresses, and invalidate those sessions.
* Use and enforce a Content Security Policy (source: Wikipedia) to disable any features that might be manipulated for an XSS attack.
* Read the documentation for any of the libraries referenced in your code to understand which elements allow for embedded HTML.

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/grafana/grafana` to version 6.0.0-beta1 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/14984)
title: Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
